places.name: Barene di Venezia
places.description: Typical salt marshes of the Venetian Lagoon, partially submerged at high tide, essential for lagoon biodiversity and ecosystem balance.

places.name: Valle Averto
places.description: A WWF protected natural reserve in the southern lagoon, composed of wetlands, fish farms, and reed beds hosting numerous bird species.

places.name: Isola di Torcello
places.description: One of the oldest inhabited islands in the lagoon, surrounded by calm canals and marshland rich in birds and aquatic vegetation.

places.name: Isola di Burano
places.description: A colorful fishing island surrounded by lagoon shallows and natural canals, preserving traditional lagoon architecture and culture.

places.name: Isola di Mazzorbo
places.description: A quiet green island connected to Burano by a bridge, with vineyards, orchards, and traces of ancient settlements.

places.name: Isola di Santâ€™Erasmo
places.description: The largest island in the lagoon, known as the 'vegetable garden of Venice' for its agricultural fields and nature trails.

places.name: Isola di San Francesco del Deserto
places.description: A small, tranquil island covered by cypress trees, inhabited by Franciscan friars since the 13th century and surrounded by quiet lagoon waters.

places.name: Barena di Campalto
places.description: A lagoon wetland area near the northern edge of Venice, rich in birdlife and tidal vegetation, part of the delicate lagoon ecosystem.

places.name: Isola della Certosa
places.description: An island turned into a green park and natural oasis, offering wildlife habitats and sustainable tourism near Venice.

places.name: Laguna Sud di Chioggia
places.description: The southern sector of the Venetian Lagoon, characterized by natural channels, sandbanks, and traditional fishing valleys.

places.name: Canale di San Felice
places.description: A navigable natural channel connecting various islands and sandbanks, surrounded by marsh vegetation and calm waters.
